If not for your current circumstance, the icy embrace of outer space would make almost for a welcoming reminder of home-- But that freedom seems distant now. They didn't give you the dignity of being sent out here alone. //A thousand suns you see to mock you. You're the farthest from the Sun you've ever been, ferried away on this baneful seraph. You can feel the hateful [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/sol-and-sauelsuesor |Stars]]] rip tendril from tendril and dig into your flesh.// A thousand artificial minds make your prison -- a thousand tons of steel, glass, and silicon, stranded out at sea in the inky void, bend and buckle and hum and pulse around you. Together, their ungodly union gives rise to the optimal cell for your imprisonment: just conscious enough to serve as a host, but not nearly spirited enough to provide you any useful resource. A prison probe set sail for distant nowhere. A faraday cage for thoughts. [[div class="raisa-header"]] Subject will undergo forced noospheric displacement by the deployment of a Hyperion-type transmitter loop and conceptually-bound Gleipnir-type chain construct in psi-space. When the loop is opened, the Gleipnir construct will attract the subject- [[/div]] For just a second, you feel an eruption of wrath for your captors. But alas, no wrathful minds to define the contours of your rage populate the void, much less the confines of your cell. [[div class="raisa-header"]] -to a powerful mental field upheld within the Conceptual Isolation Bunker (CIB), to be sustained at a concentration of 10,000 ω/cm³ within the vessel. The subject will inhabit the host consciousness, and the vessel will subsequently activate. [[/div]] //God willing, you'll drink of the swallowtail's tear and return to the Deep. It's calmer there, the monotonous whir of unworldly flutes a pallid serenade like midnight after the Moon is killed.// You find yourself wanting your desperation to give way to hopeless oblivion now. But again, no mind to feel your desired emotion can be found here in the void. No true human mind, that is -- no mind that can tune itself to your isolated noetic channel, nor conceive of its imagination any concept that informs your whole. [[=]] [[image https://i.imgur.com/O1h1Eig.png]] [[/=]] The metal minds that make themselves your tormentors are no substitute for the brains of humans. By design, the extent of their thoughtforms is tightly constrained; limited to the confines of the isolated channel in which you now find yourself. There is no synthesis here. Only the monotonous hum of hollow, constructed intelligences utterly unpossessing of the spark of spontaneous innovation. [[div class="raisa-header"]] An onboard Artificial Intelligence Conscript (hereafter Turing.aic) has been prepared and trained in accordance with the protocols of the CIB's noospheric channel and will serve as the host consciousness for the subject. [[/div]] //Before you, the embodiment of your torture writhes beneath the veneer of harmlessness like Noumena defanged.// You are a furious thoughtform. A slain egregore, once mighty in power, but nothing more in form than the confluence of collective thoughts. Those fleeting concepts have faded in the inky black, and you with them. Isolation is a slow and cruel death. Slowly, you starve. Day One - 11/06/1923

I am quite sickish at present, so I must apologize to my future self for the brevity of this entry. I would have loved to write in great detail of this whole escapade, but the teetering of this boat makes it quite difficult to focus, and the foul chum they use as bait on this vessel is certainly not making me feel any better. Nevertheless, we have almost made it. I see the peninsula out on the distant horizon; it mustn't be any more than thirty minutes until our arrival. The Foundation has made their intentions with this mission quite clear: find out what happened to the last party they'd sent. The last signal they'd gotten was incoherent and at times completely inaudible -- it came from the South Pole. We have a rough idea of where their frozen corpses might be, and so that's where we've been sent. We've been spared most of the details, but based on those selected for this expedition, one could presume what this thing may be. I find myself surrounded by parapsychologists of all disciplines, each renowned in their field. Well, excluding Sir Alister Gordon -- he has recently been the subject of significant scrutiny for several sacrilegious statements. I doubt his selection for this assignment comes from any place other than one of nepotism. It's of no matter, as the remainder of this party is truly quite an excellent group. I hold much respect for their work, and I truly believe that our combined efforts will resolve this issue quite quickly. I've gleaned that this is an umbral entity of sorts. I know not of the specifics -- the Foundation has withheld that from us, I know not why -- but I doubt that will be much of an issue. Our organization has brought its very best and brightest... and Sir Gordon. If we can't resolve this, then nobody can. I'm also very grateful for the guides that have been afforded to us on this mission. While us parapsychologists may posses knowledge kept hidden from most, we lack the experience to survive in such extreme environments as this. They've both worked at research bases here for several years now, and I trust that they will manage to negate our incompetence in the cold. What I don't understand is the location of occurrence. While many explorers have died on expeditions to this frozen hellscape, the fatalities suffered are negligible when considering that of the other six continents. Spectral activity is a rare evil even in lands where billions have died. What are the chances that such a thing would occur in a place laying claim to mere dozens of corpses? The others on this boat may very well disagree, but I believe that this sprit is not an earthly one. It seems we've just about arrived. I must prepare my things before leaving, so I wont write anything more until we begin hiking come morning. I've also just got a terrible headache. A practicing telepath whose talents first manifested at the age of nine, Buckham displays inordinate mental stability and wellbeing compared to her colleagues. Reynoso upholds an unorthodox theory of spiritual manifestations, similar to Mesmer's animal magnetism, which is not widely upheld by the parascientific consensus -- nevertheless, his methodology by all means produces genuine metaphograms. The good doctor's unique approach toward spirit photography, which he often refers to as "prana charting", likely takes great influence from time studying esotericism in the Orient in his earlier life. From 1899 to 1910, Reynoso extensively studied eastern mysticism under Lamas in Tibet, dharmic Gurus in India, and even as a student of one "Master Yttoric", another eccentric westerner in the practice of dharmic esotericism, for a period of seven months in Bengal and Burma. Though he has been deemed to occupy a crucial role on the upcoming mission, concerns surrounding Dr. Reynoso's sanctity of mind have been raised to high command. To this end, Gordon’s methodology involves the consumption of psychotropic substances, as prescribed by Foundation-approved physicians and psychiatrists, to activate psionic capabilities. This often includes more experimental mind-altering pharmaceuticals, including those of anomalous nature. Despite concerns of long-term neurochemical damage, these substances have been approved by Foundation parapsychology authorities on grounds of the benefits gained from Sir Gordon’s psychonautic expeditions. Himself a noted eccentric and personal friend of Dr. Sigmund Freud, Sir Gordon has even joined him in his advocacy for the medical benefits of psychotropic drugs including cocaine. Gordon descends from a long lineage of esotericists associated with the British government and royal family, having inherited a position at the Foundation upon the death of his father, a high-ranking operative of what was once His Majesty’s Royal Foundation for the Secure Containment of the Paranormal (HMRFSCP), in 1902. In his initial position as an alchemical researcher, Sir Gordon’s inconsequential discoveries led to his reassignment to the Psionics Division for service in the experimental, and potentially dangerous, Psychonautics Corps in 1905. His efforts as a member of this force have been more successful, recently culminating in his official knighthood granted after his discovery of a conspiracy in the parliament of the United Kingdom. While his expertise in psychonautics is considerable and he has been deemed necessary for the upcoming Antarctic mission, Gordon’s colleagues have reported his making frequent unsupported claims regarding the nature of parapsychic phenomena and non-Earth dimensions. This has made him a somewhat controversial figure in his department, though command has nevertheless approved his accession to the mission on the previously stated grounds of necessity. Day Two - 12/06/1923

It is quite cold in this place. I know that sounds obvious, and I of course knew it going in, but it is so much more intense than what one could imagine. That wind burns -- a burn I'm not quite used to. My throbbing head isn't doing me any favors, either. As soon as the wind subsides, that splitting headache comes right into focus. It's very hard to try making breakthroughs on this case when every part of your body is telling you not to go further and the hostile conditions are actively repelling you. We have made progress though. We've gone nearly twelve kilometers so far, and we've still got several more hours before settling down for the night. Well, not that there really is any actual 'day' or 'night' at this time of year. Constant darkness, every day, for months. Right now, we've just set up a few tents to rest for an hour or so. Our legs are tired, and those heavy woolen jackets were getting very uncomfortable. So far we haven't seen too much unusual activity. Paul has been flaunting a variety of esoteric devices which require a level of understanding beyond my own to truly make use of. What I do know, is they've come up empty. His talk of a new form of white detector capable of attracting "hostile psions" has yet to produce any real results. I tried focusing on the thing for a few seconds to see if and how it worked, but I couldn't get a stable connection. Instead, my headache just got worse. These conditions make it difficult to focus on anything, let alone a tiny recursive telegraph. ---------------------------------------------------------- I've just attempted to do a tarot reading a little bit before I sat down here to write. The results were inconclusive. I couldn't focus on the cards -- I'm sure there was some meaning to them but in my current state I couldn't quite grasp it. My mind is quite foggy, and it all seems so distant. I feel like I can almost sense something, but it drifts away from my fingertips every time I try to touch it. ---------------------------------------------------------- The Foundation finally radioed us over the actual reports the last party had sent out. They still won't tell us why the mission had occurred in the first place, but we at least know what the group said. I suspect we are dealing with something much more sinister than a simple spirit. This is not what I meant when I said this thing was unearthly. This is... something else entirely. The others still seem to think it's just a ghost. ---------------------------------------------------------- The others are asleep right now, but I wanted to get the rest of my thoughts down onto the paper. I've had a vision; I'm left quite confused by it. A vast plane of ice and snow filled my whole vision. Nothing ahead, nothing behind. Just pure, empty tundra. After a few seconds, it simply subsided, but I still haven't been able to get it out of my head. I don't get premonitions of the mundane and predictable. I just don't. I've passed dozens of places virtually indistinguishable from what I saw, and will surely see dozens more. What was it trying to tell me? ---------------------------------------------------------- It took me at least an hour to actually fall asleep, and the second I finally did, Alister burst into the tent. He's high on some new drug I haven't heard of. "Agnostics", he called them. He said he could feel the entity. Spouted off about how "it touched his mind, and danced him into the sun." I have my opinions on the man, but I can't help but feel like he's telling the truth. There's...
